name: Trees Around the Branch Tour at S. Walter Stewart Library
description: The S. Walter Stewart Library and its neighbourhood is home to a variety of trees. Join City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff to explore the natural world on a local neighbourhood walk. Learn how to recognize different species and fun facts about their cultural and ecological importance. Please note that the tour will start and end at the S. Walter Stewart Library foyer and will be guided by the City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff. There may be uneven, unpaved surfaces along the route outside and around the neighbourhood. Please dress and prepare accordingly for this outdoor program (e.g. hats, sunscreen, water, comfortable shoes).

organizer.name: Urban Forestry, Natural Environment and Community Programs

name: Jr. Forest Explorers: Nature Play
description:
Join us for a caregiver and toddler nature program. Connect with the natural world through hands-on outdoor activities.

Sibling policy: This program is for children 18 months to three-and-a-half years old. Children up to age four are welcome if they have not started school (i.e. those entering JK in fall 2023 who are four-years-old are welcome). Please contact us directly for specific inquiries about bringing a child outside the age range. Thank you for your cooperation.

Nature Play: Imagination, exploration and fun are at the heart of this free play program. We will be combining natural and human made loose parts to create an exciting forest adventure!

name: Multi-Tenant (Rooming) Houses Framework Survey
description: The City of Toronto invites you to share your experiences with the new regulatory framework for multi-tenant (rooming) houses that came into effect on March 31, 2024. Multi-tenant house owners, operators, tenants and other Toronto residents can share their feedback via an online survey. Feedback will help shape improvements to program delivery, education and enforcement.

name: Threads of Expression: A Journey Through Mediums
description: Experience the creative vision of emerging artists in Centennial College's Fine Art Studio Program. This exhibition showcases contemporary painting, sculpture and multimedia works, fostering an inspiring dialogue about art's purpose and its accessibility, while celebrating the diverse voices of graduating artists.
image: https://secure.toronto.ca/webapps/CC/fileAPI/edc_eventcal/Paint By Faith, Not By Sight,  Mani Chung alcohol ink print, 2024_XkqVhQ2zfY2UoAZDfYET_g.png

organizer.name: Clark Centre for the Arts - City of Toronto

name: Jokers Wild - Strip Poker meets Roast Battle Comedy
description:
Comedians bare it all for your laughs, with explosive roast battles with strip poker! Come on stage and sling fiery roast jokes, and whosever doesn't land takes off a piece of clothing. The battle ends when one is down to their unmentionables - or if they forfeit first. One things for sure - the show will be a night to remember. And that's the naked truth. Created and hosted by Roast Master Bash.

WARNING: This is a ROAST show. No subject matter is off limits. While we can promise our main goal is to be funny, we cannot promise they'll be to everyone's taste. Please exercise discretion when buying tickets!
